channel.title: Realflow - Call me stupid, but
channel.description:
I just can't figure out how to make particles collide with objects. :(
All of the tutorials on google are for RF3, and the interface and everything has completely changed.
I know it has something to do with the links menu, but I've tried adding a Collision Daemon or whatever and it doesn't work. Someone help?

item.title: Realflow - Call me stupid, but
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Well I don’t know what I did but it’s working now, thanks guys.

SomethingToHide, I’ll be sure to check out the help documentation as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Realflow - Call me stupid, but
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

RF4? Yeah. Anything you add normally gets put in Global Links section. Check there and make sure everything is there.

I’m guessing that’s a plane you have. Is it a modeled plane brought in from something else? Maybe the normals are backwards.

Check the plane’s Particle Interaction settings. I usually change Collision Distance a lot lower and Tolerance to 0.

The RealFlow Help files (Just goto the help menu?) are really good. Check them out.

I’ve never tried adding a plane from RealFlow, but I’d imagine it’d be no different.

Just make sure your plane is facing the right way and that they’re all in the global links section.

Read full topic

item.title: Realflow - Call me stupid, but
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

It’s a plane from the object menu in realflow, I also tried importing a concave mesh from 3dsMax, neither worked.

They show up and everything, but the particles just go right through.

Read full topic
